sen.j: 伏見桃山駅（ふしみももやまえき）は、京都府京都市伏見区両替町4丁目にある、京阪電気鉄道京阪本線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Ryogae-machi, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Fushimi-momoyama Station Station is a railway stop on the Keihan Main Line of Keihan Electric Railway.
Fushimi-momoyama Station, located in Ryogae-machi, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway stop on the Keihan Main Line of Keihan Electric Railway.
Fushimi-momoyama Station, located in 4-chome, Ryogae-machi, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway stop on the Keihan Main Line of Keihan Electric Railway.

sen.j: 駅概要
sen.e: Summary of the station
Summary of the station
Summary

sen.j: 伏見区の中心部、大手筋に面しており、戦前は急行列車停車駅であった。
sen.e: Placed along Otesuji-dori Street at the center of Fushimi Ward, express trains stopped at this station before the war.
Because it is placed along Otesuji-dori Street at the center of Fushimi Ward, express trains stopped at this station before the war.
Because it is placed along Otesuji-dori Street at the center of Fushimi Ward, express trains stopped at this station before the war.

sen.j: しかし隣の丹波橋駅が奈良電気鉄道（現・近鉄京都線）との接続駅となったことから急行停車駅の座を奪われ、さらに京阪宇治線の分岐駅が土地買収などの関係で南隣の中書島駅となったことや、駅南北を踏切に挟まれてホームの8両対応化が不可能であることから、伏見区の中心部に所在するにもかかわらず、急行や特別急行列車・K特急が通過という状態となっている。
sen.e: However, sicne adjacently-locating Tambabashi Station became to be used by Nara Electric Railway (present Kintetsu Kyoto Line) as well, the express trains became to stop at Tambabashi Station instead of this station, and because of the following reasons, no express train, no limited express train nor K-limited express train stops at this station, even though it is placed at the center of Fushimi Ward: Keihan Uji Line was branched at Chushojim Station, the next stop on the south side of this station, due to land acquisition and other problems, and the platforms could not support eight-car trains because a pedestrian crossing is placed on each of the north and south sides of the station.

However, since the adjacently located Tambabashi Station became to be used by Nara Electric Railway (presently the Kintetsu Kyoto Line) as well, the express trains began making stops at Tambabashi Station instead of this station, no express train, limited express train or K-limited express train stops at this station even though it is placed at the center of Fushimi Ward because the Keihan Uji Line was branched at Chushojim Station, the next stop on the south side of this station, due to land acquisition and other problems, and the platforms could not support eight-car trains because pedestrian crossings are placed on the north and south sides of the station.

However, although Fushimi-momoyama Station is situated at the center of Fushimi Ward, no express trains, limited express trains, or K-limited express trains stop there due to the following reasons: Tanbabashi Station, located adjacent to this station, started to be used by Nara Electric Railway (presently the Kintetsu Kyoto Line) as well, so express trains began making stops at Tanbabashi Station instead of Fushimi-momoyama Station; Chushojima Station, the next stop to the south of this station became the junction station for the Keihan Uji Line due to land acquisition and other issues; and the platforms could not support eight-car trains because pedestrian crossings are located to the north and south of the station.

sen.j: また、駅名にちなんでホーム屋根の柱や梁を桃色（ピンク）に塗られたこともあった。
sen.e: In the past, the roof, pillars and beams were painted pink after the name of this station.
In the past, the roof, pillars and beams were painted pink after the name of this station.
In the past, the roof, pillars and beams were painted pink after the name of this station (the Japanese kanji for "momo" in "Fushimi-momoyama" means "peach").
sen.cmt: 「桃山」にちなんでピンクとなる、という意味を追加しました。

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のホームを持つ地平駅で、改札とコンコースは地下に設けられている。
sen.e: It is placed on the ground, with two separate platforms with two tracks served between them, but the entrance/exit gate and concource are placed underground.
It is placed on the ground, with two separate platforms with two tracks served between them, but the entrance/exit gate and concourse are placed underground.
It is placed on the ground, with two separate platforms with two tracks served between them, but the ticket gate and concourse are placed underground.
sen.cmt: 改札→ticket gate としました。

sen.j: ただし油掛通側からの入場はできない。
sen.e: This station cannot be entered from the Aburakake-dori Street side.
This station can't be entered from the Aburakake-dori Street side.
This station can't be entered from the Aburakake-dori Street side.

sen.j: のりば
sen.e: Platforms
Platforms
Platforms

sen.j: この駅の南北を横切る、大手筋通と油掛通の間隔がホームの長さとなっており、ちょうど7両分ぴったりである。
sen.e: The length of the platforms, just for seven-car trains, is determined by the distance between the Otesuji-dori Street Aburakake-dori Street, each of which is placed in the north or south of the station.

The length of the platforms, enough to accommodate seven-car trains, is determined by the distance between the Otesuji-dori Street and Aburakake-dori Street, which are respectively located on the north and south side of the station.

The length of the platforms, enough to accommodate seven-car trains, is determined by the distance between the Otesuji-dori Street and Aburakake-dori Street, which are respectively located on the north and south side of the station.

sen.j: そのため、8両編成の列車が停車できない。
sen.e: Therefore, no eight-car train can stop at this station.
Consequently, no eight-car train can stop at this station.
Consequently, no eight-car train can stop at this station.

sen.j: ただし、出町柳行きホームは7両対応とはいえ無理に延伸したため、ホーム幅の狭い部分がある（丹波橋側で乗るように看板が設置されている）。
sen.e: However, since the length was extended forcedly, a portion of the platform for the trains for Demachiyanagi is norrow even though it is said that the platform supports seven-car trains (an information board guiding paggenssers to get on tains on the Tambabashi side is placed).

However, since the length was necessarily extended, a portion of the platform for the trains for Demachiyanagi is narrow even though it is said that the platform supports seven-car trains (there is an information board guiding passengers to get on trains on the Tambabashi side).

However, since the length was necessarily extended, a portion of the platform for the trains for Demachiyanagi is narrow even though it is said that the platform supports seven-car trains (there is an information board guiding passengers to get on trains on the Tanbabashi side).

sen.j: 番線表示はない。
sen.e: No track number is displayed.
No track number is displayed.
No Platform number is displayed.
sen.cmt: 番線をのりばと解釈して訳を変更。

sen.j: 100mほど東方には近鉄京都線の桃山御陵前駅（こちらは急行・準急列車が停車）がある（ただし、両線の公式な連絡駅は隣の丹波橋駅となっている）。
sen.e: In around 100-m east of this station, Momoyamagoryo-mae Station on Kintetsu Kyoto Line is located, (where express trains and semi-express trains stop) (however, the official station to connect the two lines is the adjacent Tanbabashi Station).

Approximately 100 meters east of this station there is Momoyamagoryo-mae Station on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line (where express and semi-express trains stop) (however, the official station to connect the two lines is the adjacent Tanbabashi Station).

Approximately 100 meters east of this station there is Momoyamagoryo-mae Station on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line (where express and semi-express trains stop) (however, the official station to connect the two lines is the adjacent Tanbabashi Station).

sen.j: 1910年（明治43年）4月15日 京阪本線開通と同時に伏見駅として開業。
sen.e: April 15, 1910: It started the operation as Fushima Station when Keihan Main Line started its operation.
April 15, 1910: It started the operation as Fushima Station concurrently with the launch of the Keihan Main Line.
April 15, 1910: It started the operation as Fushimi Station concurrently with the launch of the Keihan Main Line.

sen.j: 1915年（大正4年）11月11日 伏見桃山駅に改称。
sen.e: November 11, 1915: Its name was changed to Fushimai-Momoyama Station.
November 11, 1915: Its name was changed to Fushimai-Momoyama Station.
November 11, 1915: Its name was changed to Fushimi-momoyama Station.

sen.j: 1916年（大正5年）4月1日 急行停車駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1916: Express trains started stopping at this station.
April 1, 1916: Express trains began making stops at this station.
April 1, 1916: Express trains began making stops at this station.

sen.j: 戦前は一貫して急行停車駅であった。
sen.e: Before the was, express trains always stopped at this station.
Before the war, express trains always stopped at the station.
Before the war, express trains always stopped at the station.

sen.j: 戦争末期に急行の運行が中止され、1946年の運行再開時に丹波橋に停車駅が変更される。
sen.e: In the final days of the war, the operation of express trains was stopped, and when the operation of express trains restarted in 1946, the express trains became to stop at Tambabashi Station instead of this station.

In the final days of the war, the operation of express trains was stopped, and when the operation of express trains restarted in 1946, the express trains began making stops at Tambabashi Station instead of here.

In the final days of the war, the operation of express trains was stopped, and when the operation of express trains restarted in 1946, the express trains began making stops at Tanbabashi Station instead of here.

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）10月1日 会社合併により京阪神急行電鉄（現在の阪急電鉄）の駅となる。
sen.e: October 1, 1943: Due to the merging of companies concerned, it became a station of Keihanshin Express Railway (present Hankyu Railway)
October 1, 1943: Due to the merger of the companies concerned, it became a station of the Keihanshin Express Railway (presently Hankyu Railway).
October 1, 1943: Due to the merger of the companies concerned, it became a station of the Keihanshin Express Railway (presently Hankyu Railway).

sen.j: 1949年（昭和24年）12月1日 会社分離により京阪電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: December 1, 1949: Coresponding to the division of the company, it became a station of Keihan Electric Railway.
December 1, 1949: Due to the division of the company, it became a station of Keihan Electric Railway.
December 1, 1949: Due to the division of the company, it became a station of Keihan Electric Railway.

sen.j: 1962年（昭和37年）4月1日 駅東側に京阪スーパーマーケット桃山店開業（現在の「京阪ザ・ストア桃山店」）
sen.e: April 1, 1962: The Momoyama store of the Keihan super-market (the present Momoyama store of KEIHAN THE STORE) was opened on the east side of this station.
April 1, 1962: The Momoyama store of the Keihan supermarket (the present Momoyama store of KEIHAN THE STORE) was opened on the east side of this station.
April 1, 1962: The Momoyama store of the Keihan supermarket (the present Momoyama store of KEIHAN THE STORE) was opened on the east side of this station.

sen.j: 1973年（昭和48年）12月9日 駅舎が地下化される。
sen.e: December 9, 1973: The station house was moved undergound.
December 9, 1973: The station house was moved undergound.
December 9, 1973: The station house was moved underground.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 2008年（平成20年）1月 エレベーター2基新設、多目的トイレなどバリアフリー化工事完了。
sen.e: January, 2008: Two new elevators were installed, and the work to make its prmises barrier-free, such as installation of a multi-purpose lavatory, was completed.
January, 2008: Two new elevators were installed, and the process of making the premises barrier-free, such as with the installation of a multipurpose lavatory, was completed.
January, 2008: Two new elevators were installed, and the process of making the premises barrier-free, such as with the installation of a multipurpose lavatory, was completed.

sen.j: 1945年に丹波橋駅での相互乗り入れが開始される以前は、この駅と桃山御陵前駅が京阪と奈良電気鉄道（→近鉄京都線）の連絡駅になっていた。
sen.e: Before both of the two lines started using Tambabashi Station in 1945, the Keihan line and the Nara Electric Railway line (→Kintetsu Kyoto Line) were connected with each other at this station and at Momoyamagoryo-mae Station

Before both of the lines started using Tambabashi Station in 1945, the Keihan Line and the Nara Electric Railway Line (→Kintetsu Kyoto Line) were interconnected at this station and Momoyamagoryo-mae Station.

Before both of the lines started using Tanbabashi Station in 1945, the Keihan Line and the Nara Electric Railway Line (present Kintetsu Kyoto Line) were interconnected at this station and Momoyamagoryo-mae Station.
sen.cmt: Tanbabashi に変更しました。→をpresent と変更しました。

sen.j: また、その当時は京阪線の急行は当駅に停車し、丹波橋は通過していた。
sen.e: At that time, express trains on the Keihan line stopped at this station, not at Tambabashi Station.
At that time, express trains on the Keihan Line stopped at this station but not at Tambabashi Station.
At that time, express trains on the Keihan Line stopped at this station but not at Tanbabashi Station.

sen.j: 京阪ザ・ストア閉鎖までは車内放送の際に駅名の後に「京阪ザ・ストア前」と呼称していた。
sen.e: Before operation of KEIHAN THE STORE was stopped, the anouncement of "KEIHAN THE STORE" was made additionally succeeding to the announcemnet of the station name in the train cars.
Before KEIHAN THE STORE ceased operation, the announcement of "KEIHAN THE STORE" was made additionally, succeeding the announcement of the station name in the train cars.
Before KEIHAN THE STORE ceased operation, the announcement of 'KEIHAN THE STORE' was made additionally, succeeding the announcement of the station name in the train cars.

sen.j: 中書島駅 - 伏見桃山駅 - 丹波橋駅
sen.e: Chushojima station - Fushimi-Momoyama Station - Tambabashi Station
